Package it.polimi.ingsw.view

Class ControllerInterpreter

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.ControllerInterpreter
public class ControllerInterpreter extends Object
The class is responsible for the interpretation of commands related to what to show on the screen. These commands are mostly issued by the server.

    • ControllerInterpreter

      public ControllerInterpreter​(Screen screen, OfflineInfo offlineInfo)
      Creates the interpreter and attaches the screen to it.
      Parameters:
      screen - Place where to show the commands received.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute​(String command)
      Executes the command specified by the caller (the server most of the cases). A server can only tells the CLI what view to show, the error message to show and to refresh the screen. Any other command results in the end of the program.
      Parameters:
      command - Command of the server

    • show

      private void show​(String... tokens)
      Shows the View contained in tokens[1]
      Parameters:
      tokens - array containing the View to show

    • hide

      private void hide​(String... tokens)
      Hides the viewable contained in tokens[1]
      Parameters:
      tokens - array containing the View to hide

    • spy

      private void spy​(String... tokens)
      Allows to show the other player's dashboard
      Parameters:
      tokens - array containing the name of the player to spy

    • error

      private void error​(String... tokens)
      Allows to show all the errors encountered
      Parameters:
      tokens - array composed by the error message

    • message

      private void message​(String... tokens)
      Allows to show messages
      Parameters:
      tokens - array composed by the message to show

    • fatal

      private void fatal​(String... tokens)
      Stops the match and shows fatal errors
      Parameters:
      tokens - array composed by the fatal error message

    • refresh

      private void refresh​(String... tokens)
      Allows to refresh the screen (and every viewable on it)
      Parameters:
      tokens - Empty

    • start

      private void start​(String... tokens)
      Starts the match
      Parameters:
      tokens - array composed by the player's name and number

    • win

      private void win​(String... tokens)
      Ends the match and declares the winner
      Parameters:
      tokens - array composed by the player number which will visualize the message and the number of the winner

    • yourTurn
